lead_paragraph: While New York City struggles to make good on a promise to develop a park along the Bushwick Inlet, a competing proposal has arisen as an alternative to a conventional green space.

headline.print_headline: Disparate Visions for a Park: Dismantle Industrial Ruins, or Preserve Them
headline.main: Disparate Visions for a Park: Dismantle Industrial Ruins, or Preserve Them

snippet: While New York City struggles to make good on a promise to develop a park along the Bushwick Inlet, a competing proposal has arisen as an alternative to a conventional green space.
abstract: Decades-old plan to convert parkland surrounding Bushwick Inlet, part of Brooklyn waterfront along Greenpoint and Williamsburg neighborhoods, into green space is being challenged by competing vision to convert it into industrial-themed site called Maker Park; latest proposal, which would preserve industrial ruins there, is prompted in part by inertia surrounding original plan, but has received pushback from community.
